verses.esv: 7 Do not be deceived: God is not mocked, for whatever one sows, that will he also reap.
verses.kjv: 7 Be not deceived; God is not mocked: for whatsoever a man soweth, that shall he also reap.
verses.niv: 7 Do not be deceived: God cannot be mocked. A man reaps what he sows.

verses.esv: 6 The point is this: whoever sows sparingly will also reap sparingly, and whoever sows bountifully will also reap bountifully.
verses.kjv: 6 But this I say, He which soweth sparingly shall reap also sparingly; and he which soweth bountifully shall reap also bountifully.
verses.niv: 6 Remember this: Whoever sows sparingly will also reap sparingly, and whoever sows generously will also reap generously.

verses.esv: 7 Do not be deceived: God is not mocked, for whatever one sows, that will he also reap. 8 For the one who sows to his own flesh will from the flesh reap corruption, but the one who sows to the Spirit will from the Spirit reap eternal life.
verses.kjv: 7 Be not deceived; God is not mocked: for whatsoever a man soweth, that shall he also reap. 8 For he that soweth to his flesh shall of the flesh reap corruption; but he that soweth to the Spirit shall of the Spirit reap life everlasting.
verses.niv: 7 Do not be deceived: God cannot be mocked. A man reaps what he sows. 8 The one who sows to please his sinful nature, from that nature will reap destruction; the one who sows to please the Spirit, from the Spirit will reap eternal life.

verses.esv:
8   Whoever sows injustice will reap calamity,
    and the rod of his fury will fail.
verses.kjv: 8 He that soweth iniquity shall reap vanity: and the rod of his anger shall fail.
verses.niv: 8 He who sows wickedness reaps trouble, and the rod of his fury will be destroyed.

verses.esv: 9 And let us not grow weary of doing good, for in due season we will reap, if we do not give up.
verses.kjv: 9 And let us not be weary in well doing: for in due season we shall reap, if we faint not.
verses.niv: 9 Let us not become weary in doing good, for at the proper time we will reap a harvest if we do not give up.

verses.esv:
18   The wicked earns deceptive wages,
    but one who sows righteousness gets a sure reward.
verses.kjv: 18 The wicked worketh a deceitful work: but to him that soweth righteousness shall be a sure reward.
verses.niv: 18 The wicked man earns deceptive wages, but he who sows righteousness reaps a sure reward.

verses.esv: 38 give, and it will be given to you. Good measure, pressed down, shaken together, running over, will be put into your lap. For with the measure you use it will be measured back to you.‚Äù
verses.kjv: 38 Give, and it shall be given unto you; good measure, pressed down, and shaken together, and running over, shall men give into your bosom. For with the same measure that ye mete withal it shall be measured to you again.
verses.niv: 38 Give, and it will be given to you. A good measure, pressed down, shaken together and running over, will be poured into your lap. For with the measure you use, it will be measured to you."

verses.esv:
8   As I have seen, those who plow iniquity
    and sow trouble reap the same.
verses.kjv: 8 Even as I have seen, they that plow iniquity, and sow wickedness, reap the same.
verses.niv: 8 As I have observed, those who plow evil and those who sow trouble reap it.

verses.esv:
7   For they sow the wind,
    and they shall reap the whirlwind.
  The standing grain has no heads;
    it shall yield no flour;
  if it were to yield,
    strangers would devour it.
verses.kjv: 7 For they have sown the wind, and they shall reap the whirlwind: it hath no stalk: the bud shall yield no meal: if so be it yield, the strangers shall swallow it up.
verses.niv: 7 "They sow the wind and reap the whirlwind. The stalk has no head; it will produce no flour. Were it to yield grain, foreigners would swallow it up.

verses.esv:
5   Those who sow in tears
    shall reap with shouts of joy!
verses.kjv: 5 They that sow in tears shall reap in joy.
verses.niv: 5 Those who sow in tears will reap with songs of joy.

verses.esv: 8 For the one who sows to his own flesh will from the flesh reap corruption, but the one who sows to the Spirit will from the Spirit reap eternal life.
verses.kjv: 8 For he that soweth to his flesh shall of the flesh reap corruption; but he that soweth to the Spirit shall of the Spirit reap life everlasting.
verses.niv: 8 The one who sows to please his sinful nature, from that nature will reap destruction; the one who sows to please the Spirit, from the Spirit will reap eternal life.

verses.esv:
12   Sow for yourselves righteousness;
    reap steadfast love;
    break up your fallow ground,
  for it is the time to seek the LORD,
    that he may come and rain righteousness upon you.
verses.kjv: 12 Sow to yourselves in righteousness, reap in mercy; break up your fallow ground: for it is time to seek the LORD, till he come and rain righteousness upon you.
verses.niv: 12 Sow for yourselves righteousness, reap the fruit of unfailing love, and break up your unplowed ground; for it is time to seek the LORD, until he comes and showers righteousness on you.

verses.kjv: 7 Be not deceived; God is not mocked: for whatsoever a man soweth, that shall he also reap. 8 For he that soweth to his flesh shall of the flesh reap corruption; but he that soweth to the Spirit shall of the Spirit reap life everlasting. 9 And let us not be weary in well doing: for in due season we shall reap, if we faint not. 10 As we have therefore opportunity, let us do good unto all men, especially unto them who are of the household of faith.

verses.esv: 6 Let the one who is taught the word share all good things with the one who teaches.
verses.kjv: 6 Let him that is taught in the word communicate unto him that teacheth in all good things.
verses.niv: 6 Anyone who receives instruction in the word must share all good things with his instructor.

verses.esv:
9   The heart is deceitful above all things,
    and desperately sick;
    who can understand it?
verses.kjv: 9 The heart is deceitful above all things, and desperately wicked: who can know it?
verses.niv: 9 The heart is deceitful above all things and beyond cure. Who can understand it?

verses.esv:
13   They have sown wheat and have reaped thorns;
    they have tired themselves out but profit nothing.
  They shall be ashamed of their harvests
    because of the fierce anger of the LORD.‚Äù
verses.kjv: 13 They have sown wheat, but shall reap thorns: they have put themselves to pain, but shall not profit: and they shall be ashamed of your revenues because of the fierce anger of the LORD.
verses.niv: 13 They will sow wheat but reap thorns; they will wear themselves out but gain nothing. So bear the shame of your harvest because of the LORD's fierce anger."

verses.esv: 16 ‚ÄúFor God so loved the world, that he gave his only Son, that whoever believes in him should not perish but have eternal life.
verses.kjv: 16 For God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son, that whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have everlasting life.
verses.niv: 16 "For God so loved the world that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him shall not perish but have eternal life.

verses.esv:
15   You shall sow, but not reap;
    you shall tread olives, but not anoint yourselves with oil;
    you shall tread grapes, but not drink wine.
verses.kjv: 15 Thou shalt sow, but thou shalt not reap; thou shalt tread the olives, but thou shalt not anoint thee with oil; and sweet wine, but shalt not drink wine.
verses.niv: 15 You will plant but not harvest; you will press olives but not use the oil on yourselves, you will crush grapes but not drink the wine.

verses.esv: 12 For if the readiness is there, it is acceptable according to what a person has, not according to what he does not have.
verses.kjv: 12 For if there be first a willing mind, it is accepted according to that a man hath, and not according to that he hath not.
verses.niv: 12 For if the willingness is there, the gift is acceptable according to what one has, not according to what he does not have.

verses.esv: 11 If we have sown spiritual things among you, is it too much if we reap material things from you?
verses.kjv: 11 If we have sown unto you spiritual things, is it a great thing if we shall reap your carnal things?
verses.niv: 11 If we have sown spiritual seed among you, is it too much if we reap a material harvest from you?

verses.esv:
28   A lying tongue hates its victims,
    and a flattering mouth works ruin.
verses.kjv: 28 A lying tongue hateth those that are afflicted by it; and a flattering mouth worketh ruin.
verses.niv: 28 A lying tongue hates those it hurts, and a flattering mouth works ruin.

verses.esv:
12   Sow for yourselves righteousness;
    reap steadfast love;
    break up your fallow ground,
  for it is the time to seek the LORD,
    that he may come and rain righteousness upon you.
13   You have plowed iniquity;
    you have reaped injustice;
    you have eaten the fruit of lies.
  Because you have trusted in your own way
    and in the multitude of your warriors,
verses.kjv: 12 Sow to yourselves in righteousness, reap in mercy; break up your fallow ground: for it is time to seek the LORD, till he come and rain righteousness upon you. 13 Ye have plowed wickedness, ye have reaped iniquity; ye have eaten the fruit of lies: because thou didst trust in thy way, in the multitude of thy mighty men.
verses.niv: 12 Sow for yourselves righteousness, reap the fruit of unfailing love, and break up your unplowed ground; for it is time to seek the LORD, until he comes and showers righteousness on you. 13 But you have planted wickedness, you have reaped evil, you have eaten the fruit of deception. Because you have depended on your own strength and on your many warriors,

verses.esv: 12 And Isaac sowed in that land and reaped in the same year a hundredfold. The LORD blessed him,
verses.kjv: 12 Then Isaac sowed in that land, and received in the same year an hundredfold: and the LORD blessed him.
verses.niv: 12 Isaac planted crops in that land and the same year reaped a hundredfold, because the LORD blessed him.

verses.esv: 7 Each one must give as he has decided in his heart, not reluctantly or under compulsion, for God loves a cheerful giver.
verses.kjv: 7 Every man according as he purposeth in his heart, so let him give; not grudgingly, or of necessity: for God loveth a cheerful giver.
verses.niv: 7 Each man should give what he has decided in his heart to give, not reluctantly or under compulsion, for God loves a cheerful giver.
